main event: Three unidentified flying objects were observed in North Jutland on January 19, 1948, moving east-west, then suddenly stopped, exploded, and disappeared.
interesting points: The objects were surrounded by a bluish light and left a short trail of green light., Several observers described the objects as looking like three balls., The objects' sudden explosion seems to support the meteoric hypothesis., The incident resembles similar reports from New Mexico regarding 'green flash' objects., The phenomenon was reported in multiple locations within North Jutland, including Hj√∏rring and the Scaw.
witness description: Observations were made by multiple witnesses in North Jutland.
